result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M Ridpath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dawn M Ridpath in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Dawn M Ridpath in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Travis Sherden is sworn and questioned by Attorney Zell. Testifies to being on patrol and receiving a report of individuals transporting controlled substances.  Testifies to going to the residence and speaking to defendant. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to requesting to see a container and testifies that defendant handed the item to him.  Cross-examination by Attorney Schmidt.  Questions witness regarding  the container.  Re-direct by Attorney Zell.  Officer Libby Abel is sworn and questioned by Attorney Zell.  Testifies to working along side Officer Sherden on the day in question.  Cross-examination by Attorney Schmidt.  Questions witness regarding the specifics of the container.  Re-direct by Attorney Zell.   Dawn Ridpath is sworn and questioned by Attorney Schmidt.  Questions witness regarding Officers Sherden and Abel arriving at her residence.  Testifies that she did not hand the officers a container.  Cross-examination by Attorney Zell.  Officer Sherden retakes the witness stand.  Attorney Zell questions witness regarding the container.  

Attorneys Zell and Schmidt give their arguments.  Motion is denied.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.
of Karl A. Schmidt
to Suppress Evidence
